title: Riot some context on the PBE Irelia and Swain nerfs if you will?
body:
Just want to know the direction you are really aiming at with the drastic ult cooldown timer increase to both of them.

Are they experimental or likely to go through?

Why are they such harsh nerfs straight up?

replies.body:
Irelia - doesn't have sufficient downtime on her ult early game especially, resulting in lack of windows to fight her, particular after returning to lane. That's been a long time problem, now that she's strong and we need to take a bit of power off her it seemed like a good time to address it. 

Swain - We're interested in a model for Swain ult where when he turns it on during a fight is a significant thing for enemies to play around. At a 10s CD, especially with a decent amount of CDR (which he'll get) there's just not sufficient downtime there for it to matter enough. Testing significantly longer CDs as a result, looking at an approach where he gets one ult activation in an average fight, two in particularly long fights. 


For both champs both the concept and the specific numbers are still being tested. It's early in the patch cycle right now, so hard to give a useful answer as to whether they'll go through without more testing. We do like both changes directionally so far though.

Well I mained Swain for a long time (was forced into another champ by his riddiculous high Pick/Ban-Rate.. thx btw) but in my opinion, doing the maokai on him is a terrible idea....

First of all Diversity: We have alot of different Champs and even more different Spells in this Game, we have the game-breakers like Shen and Karthus, we have the Transformers like Nida and Jayce, we have massive CC or DMG... AND we have the Gamplay changers (spells that completely changes the way a champion is played after 6) Anivia and Swain are the examples here! 
After 6 your stance on lane switches, not until you've used your ult, no, permanently! That's the magic of those champions, that why I picked both of them up in the first place!

On old Swain there was a simple problem you always had to calculate, your MANA BAR! (I knew lowering Swains mana costs and buff mana items is a bad idea .. just saying...) In a Teamfight, you always had to think about when to turn your Ult off (NOT IF). You needed to get those kills/Asissts for Passive, and your enemys could play around your mana costs quite well! 

With the 30s Swains gamplay looks like this -  Ult on -> all in(exactly like Mao), never toggle off. That's it, such wow, much gameplay, great decision making...  No short poke, no baits, not even clear a camp to get some health back... 
Looking at build paths: {{item:3003}} + {{item:3027}} has no alternative, because you have to Ult for a long time, espically when fighting exactly those Tanks YOU SAID Swain should counter quite well. 
Guess we're seeing a Timelimit on Swains Ult soon.... 

I dont say, bring old Swain back (although this would fix alot of problems.. especially mine)...
But is there really no way to balance a Toggle-Ult???

I'm really wondering what Swain's new buildpath will be. I don't think that forcing him onto AA/Seraph's will feel good. I'm generally not a fan of the Roa+tear build anyway (not a Swain thing, delaying your power that much just doesn't feel good to me unless the game time is reliably long). Will you just be essentially locked out of building early defenses?

I also agree with you that this looks like it will alter Swain's gameplay paradigm, and not in a way that I think will enrich the game. If this does wind up removing a decision point, it would be all the worse for being on the master tactician champion.

I'm slightly uneasy about the philosophy behind the swain nerf in how it's based on him getting a lot of CDR in his build. It feels weird to balance around a subjective stat that may or may not be present in any given game. Swain may have 40% CDR by 20 minutes or he may have 10%. That feels like saying, "We should nerf blitz's AP ratios because he can build damage and one shot people." It makes sense for Swains that have 40% CDR at 25 minutes, but it drastically hurts those at 11 minutes with no CDR beyond blue buff.

I get the concept of playability windows, but the problem seems to have more to do with the functionality of his ultimate as a sustainable shape-change that deals damage, heals him, and costs a large amount of mana if he wants to maintain it for a long time. It feels like playing around Swain ult atm is dependent on making him go oom to fight him, which is obviously bad. At the same time, Swain loses a lot of sustain because he now has to wait about 3x as long to actually heal from minions and champions. It makes him more likely to try and get as much out of the ult as he can by keeping it on longer so he can heal more/deal more damage. That could lead to bigger mana problems because he doesn't want to use a 30s CD for nothing/not a lot of benefit.

Any thoughts on that balance philosophy? It seems like it creates another problem while trying to solve one.

As a swain player 30 second ultimate will hurt him incredibly during laning phase.

During lane you activate ultimate in order to do this:

-For 2-3 seconds in order to heal from minions.
-To harass/finish off someone that got caught by Q/W (most obvious)
-To last hit in turret (a must, you activate for a brief second and deactivate again)
-To waveclear (a must in some matchups, take for example viktor,ziggs,xerath they will always push to your turret, they're counters this will only make the matchup worse)
-To avoid ganks.

As you can see there are many situations where you'd like to pop the ultimate for a few seconds and then deactivate it. Not to mention that since patch 6.10 for some reason i sometimes disable my ultimate and i don't know if its something im doing by accident or there's some sort of bug- previously you couldn't disable it by double clicking.

Keep this change ahead and i foresee a <50% winrate, for a champion that due to his playrate and being a niche pick has always been 50%+ winrate, yet considered trash in high elo.

As an Irelia player, I actually agree with this and it's a good way to hit her without being too severe. With her ult having such a ridiculously low cooldown even at rank 1, it's often the case where "Is there some way I can use my ult right now?" is met with "yeah, why not, it'll be back up soon."

I mean, I rarely hesitate to use it just to push the wave when I'm planning to recall. Odds are it'll be up again before I need to all-in, particularly if I'm walking back to lane instead of teleporting back.

For Swain could you put it at say, 12 seconds but make it immune to CDR? I mean 30 seconds changes his playstyle a crap ton. It would be like giving one of Udyr's stances a 20 second cd but much stronger form.

On the topic of Irelia, what about the fact that she gets 40% CDR from Tri+Kindlegem+Warhammer. The last two are components of a very viable core buid (Tri+SV+GB+Tabi).

I feel like the last tri force changes basically gave her "free" 40% CDR which covers up one of Irelia's laning weaknesses. Many matchups that used to be able to abuse her were centered around being able to fight on a shorter window than her W cooldown (Renekton, Riven...) but are both in positions where their trading window is almost equal to hers and is significantly weaker than hers.

A huge part of the strength of Irelia on the last two patches comes from this **ease of getting 40% CDR** with items that she very much likes. Before Tri force had CDR, the core build was FH+SV to give 30% CDR, but it only did this after spending over 3k gold on defensive items (FH+kindlegem) after Tri Force, on the current patch the same can be acquired by just completing Tri Force and Kindlegem. The result, is also that she can have a hybrid damage-tank lategame build (Tri+Ghosblade+Visage+tank) which gives 40% CDR from relatively early in the game (by 20 min she has 40%) which gives her Q a cooldown of under 4 seconds, basically rendering the Q reset mechanic irrelevant as she doesn't have to be careful about when she uses it.

I would have proposed that the stats on **tri force are returned to AD/HP and possibly some AP, bringing it back to a 10% or 0% CDR item.** And that her Q cooldown is increased to around 8 seconds when maxed. Also,** it would be nice to see some changes that allow the return of early-dominant champions like Renekton, Riven, Pantheon, Olaf, Rumble, and maybe even Darius** that allow her to be countered in lane, as her Irelia's identity has always been a moderately weak early and late balanced by a spiky midgame.

Speaking from my experience with Irelia, the greater part of lack of windows to fight her when she's ahead comes from the E-W combo winning trades for free.
